item.title: Helen add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I'll think of it tomorrow, at Tara. I can stand it then. Tomorrow, I'll think of some way to get him back. After all, tomorrow is another day." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Helen add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Helen add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Helen add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Helen add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "And so the lion fell in love with the lamb…" he murmured. I looked away, hiding my eyes as I thrilled to the word. "What a stupid lamb," I sighed. "What a sick, masochistic lion." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Helen add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Helen add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "Fall down again, Bella?' No, Emmett, I punched a werewolf in the face." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Helen add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "Hey, Rosalie? Do you know how to drown a blonde? Stick a mirror to the bottom of a pool." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Helen add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "About three things I was absolutely positive. First, Edward was a vampire. Second, there was a part of him-and I didn’t know how potent that part might be-that thirsted for my blood. And third, I was unconditionally and irrevocably in love with him." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Helen add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly." -- Stephenie Meyer
